item.description:
Hi Folks,

This is the second go-around on what must be our most in-demand meeting yet. If we get to more than 15 people signing up, I will find a larger venue, probably a classroom on campus. Not as comfortable as our conference room, but this way all can come.

Our esteemed John Gregg will start us off this time with a guarded defense of free-will. His essay on the subject can be found here John's Free Will Essay I and here John's Essay II

If there's time, I'll present my anti-free-will argument that doesn't call upon determinism or causality, or maybe save that for another meeting. I have to write it up first as a power point, so can't give you a link right now.

See you there.

Sean

group.name: The Boston Philosophy of Mind Group

item.name: You Have No Choice but to Believe in Free Will: Round II
